channel.title: Question
channel.description:
What insturment would you play if you were able to learn how to play it pretty well? If you already play an instrument, state which one you use.
As for me, if I could learn to play something, it'd probably be bass guitar or the drums. More likely, it'd be the drums since rock music wouldn't where it is without them; they basically serve as the backbone of a band's music.

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Trombone is awesome! You get to be a tromboner (tehehe).

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Well I’d like to be able to play what I do play better

Other than that… the didge, although I’ll be working on that soon (most of it is improv anyway tbh). Wouldn’t mind a brass instrument under my belt… trombone makes the leetest noise!

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

I play alto and tenor sax.

I want to play trombone, trumpet, and guitar.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

If I had my choice I’d attempt to learn how to play 12 string bass =D but they cost a lot and I don’t have any commitment to music any more.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Dunno. Drums or electric guitar. :\ Hard choice to make… I’ll say guitar.

Read full topic

item.description:

Guitar. I’m trying to learn but don’t have a whole lot of time for it.
